thread.title: Snowmobilers enjoying the intense winter so far
thread.title_full: Snowmobilers enjoying the intense winter so far

author: Hannah Devanny
title: Snowmobilers enjoying the intense winter so far
text:
Snowmobilers enjoying the intense winter so far
Parts of Central New York have already seen several feet of snow so far.
This is before the technical start date of winter.
This isn't a given in December. For snowmobilers, this means early access to the trails.
More snow means more time for many to utilize their snowmobiles.
This generates additional business for those working in the snowmobile industry.
On the maintenance and retail side of the business, many have had a busy start to the season.
Kyle Conover, the owner's son at KDK Sports, said, "Service is jam-packed right now."
Although this year has been a good snowmobile season so far, previous years, besides last, haven't been as snowy.
"Last year was super busy," explained Conover. "Years prior, they weren't, and people weren't as thrilled with the conditions."
Snowmobile trails were empty on Thursday in Oswego County. Many of them were closed due to the warm weather. For many restaurants in the county, those trails are how patrons get to the businesses throughout the winter months. The impact is huge.
